fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: MetLife LTC LifeStage Advantage

fields.name: Subtitle
fields.value: Plans-at-a-Glance

fields.name: Insurance Type
fields.value: INSURANCE | LONG-TERM CARE

fields.name: Company Name
fields.value: MetLife

fields.name: Plan Column Header - Simple
fields.value: SIMPLE ADVANTAGE4 PLAN

fields.name: Plan Column Header - Custom
fields.value: CUSTOM ADVANTAGE4 PLAN

fields.name: Plan Type
fields.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: Issue Ages (Simple Advantage)
fields.value: 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: Issue Ages (Custom Advantage)
fields.value: 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA) Options
fields.value: MBA options: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K. TBA options: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K, $1MM* (*$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider).

fields.name: Optional Riders Available
fields.value: Shared Care Rider: Insured and spouse/partner can access each other's benefits once TBA under their own policy is exhausted; when insured dies remaining TBA transfers to spouse/partner at no extra cost. Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or is cancelled by insured; must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when policy ends; provides full MBA and reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; available at initial application only. Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; benefits may be taxable.

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO)
fields.value: Included with Simple Advantage only. Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years to age 65 with no additional underwriting; premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; increases will not occur if insured is eligible for benefits.

fields.name: Benefit Increase Options
fields.value: Available with Custom Advantage only. Future Purchase Option (FPO): increases MBA and remaining portion of TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA each year if elected; increases occur unless insurer rejects in writing; corresponding increase in premium; if insurer rejects twice in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases but can request to have offer reinstated. Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA in effect at end of previous policy year by either 3% or 5% with corresponding premium increase; 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider and 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider available.

fields.name: Footer Notice
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION. Metropolitan Life Insurance Company (MetLife)

tables.caption: Comparison: Simple Advantage Plan vs Custom Advantage Plan

rows.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA)

fields.name: document_title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: main_header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services – Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver – Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage is provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums, or the insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: additional_information_header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal* -- 15% Marital* -- 15% Residential -- 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) -- 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: Underwriting Classes
fields.value: Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)

fields.name: Save Age
fields.value: Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application)

fields.name: company_address_footer
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166

reasoningNotes: Populated fields only where explicit evidence appears in the extraction JSON; did not infer ADL criteria or specific rehabilitation/service-level triggers because no ADL definitions were present in the source.

Elimination Period entries were taken verbatim. EP related fields (EP Calendar/Service Days and EP Renewal or Lifetime) were derived from the elimination period text '100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative'. Confidence 0.8 reflects clear extraction.

Benefit amounts (MBA/TBA) pulled from page 1 had lower confidence (0.6) in source extraction; therefore Maximum Monthly Limit and Maximum Lifetime $Benefit set with 0.6 confidence and include note about $1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider.

Where Home and Community Care and Facility Care list covered services, mapped those descriptions to corresponding schema fields (Home Health Care, Homemaker Services, Nursing Home, Assisted Living, Adult Day Care, Personal Care Services, Personal Care Advisor, Care Coordination). These mappings are semantic and based on explicit phrases in the source.

Nonforfeiture/Contingent Benefit language appears in two places (Optional Riders on page 1 and Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse on page 2); combined into Nonforfeiture Benefit field and Cancellation/Contingent-lapse explanation.
Indemnity Benefit populated from Cash Benefit Rider description. Confidence moderate (0.6) because original extraction confidence was 0.6.

Several fields remain null due to absence of explicit text in the provided extraction (ADL specifics, DME amounts, respite specifics, hospice amounts/days, many assistance-level fields). Per rules, these were left null rather than fabricated.

prompt.system:
You are building canonical data for illumifin claims processing. You are given OCR extraction results (fields and tables) for a multi-page document along with page-level document type hints. Classify the overall content into one or more of: 'facility_invoice', 'cmr_form', 'ub04'. Input JSON includes a pages array where each page has fields with IDs, values, and normalized bounding boxes (x, y, width, height all between 0 and 1 relative to the page). When populating sources, always reference the provided field IDs (fieldId) or table IDs (tableId) and include the page number. Table metadata includes column headers/keys and cell-level bounding boxes; include the column name when pointing to table sources. Then produce a JSON object matching this schema exactly: {
  "generatedAt": ISO8601 timestamp,
  "documentTypes": [string],
  "facilityInvoice": { optional, object with keys "general" (dict of canonical field name -> value object) and "lineItems" (list of dict canonicalName->value object) },
  "cmrForm": { optional, similar structure with sections },
  "ub04": { optional, provider fields },
  "notes": [string]
 }.
Each canonical value object must be of form {"value": string or null, "confidence": number 0-1, "sources": [ {"page": int optional, "fieldId": string optional, "tableId": string optional, "column": string optional } ] }. Confidence is your mapping confidence (not OCR confidence). Populate as many facility invoice fields as possible: policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, invoiceNumber, invoiceDate, taxId, totalAmount, balanceDue, credits. For lineItems include description, startDate, endDate, unitType, quantity, amount, balance, totalDue, credits. For CMR include policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, serviceFrom, serviceThrough, careLevelSelection, absenceIndicator (yes/no) plus absenceDetails (departureDate, returnDate, reason, admissionDate, dischargeDate), insuranceIndicator and insuranceSelections (medicare, medicaid, other), signaturePresent (yes/blank) and signatureDate. For UB04 include providerName, providerAddress. Always provide an empty object for a section if it applies but data is missing. If no content applies, set documentTypes to ['other'] and return empty sections. Do not invent data. Leave value as null when evidence is absent. Provide reasoning notes in the notes array when confidence is low.

values.value: Included with Simple Advantage only. Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years to age 65 with no additional underwriting; premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; increases will not occur if insured is eligible for benefits.

fields.bestValue: Included with Simple Advantage only. Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years to age 65 with no additional underwriting; premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; increases will not occur if insured is eligible for benefits.

values.value: Available with Custom Advantage only. Future Purchase Option (FPO): increases MBA and remaining portion of TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA each year if elected; increases occur unless insurer rejects in writing; corresponding increase in premium; if insurer rejects twice in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases but can request to have offer reinstated. Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA in effect at end of previous policy year by either 3% or 5% with corresponding premium increase; 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider and 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider available.

fields.name: Optional Riders Available
fields.value: Shared Care Rider: Insured and spouse/partner can access each other's benefits once TBA under their own policy is exhausted; when insured dies remaining TBA transfers to spouse/partner at no extra cost. Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or is cancelled by insured; must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when policy ends; provides full MBA and reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; available at initial application only. Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; benefits may be taxable.

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO)
fields.value: Included with Simple Advantage only. Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years to age 65 with no additional underwriting; premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; increases will not occur if insured is eligible for benefits.

fields.name: Benefit Increase Options
fields.value: Available with Custom Advantage only. Future Purchase Option (FPO): increases MBA and remaining portion of TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA each year if elected; increases occur unless insurer rejects in writing; corresponding increase in premium; if insurer rejects twice in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases but can request to have offer reinstated. Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA in effect at end of previous policy year by either 3% or 5% with corresponding premium increase; 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider and 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider available.

fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage is provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums, or the insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: additional_information_header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal* -- 15% Marital* -- 15% Residential -- 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) -- 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: Underwriting Classes
fields.value: Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)

fields.name: Save Age
fields.value: Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application)

fields.name: company_address_footer
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166

rows.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services – Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver – Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason
